page.title: 08 MAUD MART TRADE
page.content: Wednesday the busiest day of the week Maud mart is the biggest one day sale mart in Britain and was the first mart in Scotland to get an automatic weighing bridge.They sell cattle,sheep and sometimes horses.You can see Sandy Duncan the local butcher there in his grey bonnet.You can hear gates opening and closing letting stirks from one pen to another,men whistling and shouting, floats starting up.You can smell the beasts.I tried to keep up with the prices.The highest was Â£480, the lowest Â£248.About 650 beasts are sold every week,but the record is 1016 Breeds are Charolais,Hereford and Friesian.A man writes the weights up on a blackboard, the heaviest today was 650kg. The cattle are sold one by one,they are ready to be killed & eaten.Sheep are sold in lots of 100 at one time.
